summary: The 'Strategy and Investment in Rural Housing Preservation Act of 2025' aims to establish a permanent program to preserve and revitalize rural multifamily rental housing. It directs the Secretary of Housing to provide notices regarding loan maturity, offers loan restructuring options, and addresses rental assistance renewals and transfers. The bill also authorizes funding for technical improvements at the Department of Agriculture and requires a plan for preserving affordability, establishing an advisory committee to assist with implementation.  Additional provisions include rural housing vouchers and changes to rental assistance contracts.
